body:
Franceâ€™s Series Mania, the biggest TV festival in Europe, will open with Disney+ title â€œThe Testaments,â€ the sequel to the â€œThe Handmaidâ€™s Taleâ€ from  Bruce Miller, showrunner of both series. Stars in attendance at Series Mania will include Ann Dowd, Aunt Lydia in â€œThe Handmaidâ€™s Taleâ€ who narrates â€œThe Testaments,â€ and Chase Infiniti and Lucy Halliday.

	This yearâ€™s lineup also includes AMC Networkâ€™s â€œThe Audacity,â€ created by Jonathan Glatzer (â€œSuccession,â€ â€œBetter Call Saulâ€) and featuring Billy Magnussen, â€œThe Big Bang Theoryâ€ star Simon Helberg and Zach Galifianakis, plus Netflix â€œPeaky Blindersâ€ movie â€œThe Immortal Man.â€ 
	

	As reported by Varietyâ€˜s Co-Editor-in-ChiefÂ Cynthia Littleton, â€œThe Audacityâ€ revolves around an aspiring tech CEO character (played by Magnussen) and a â€œsuccessful but deeply alienatedâ€ founder and inventor played by Helberg.


	â€œThereâ€™s times in history where thereâ€™s a Renaissance and Silicon Valley is one of those times in our modern era which is defining humanity,â€ said Magnussen, while Helberg called his character a â€œmaladjusted genius.â€

	â€œHeâ€™s a bit of a recluse. And thereâ€™s loneliness at the heart of all the characters, and theyâ€™re all trying to connect, and theyâ€™re trying to connect through technology, which has some pitfalls.â€

	Opening up about this yearâ€™s trends, Managing Director Laurence Herszberg and Artistic Director FrÃ©dÃ©ric Lavigne noted that while there has been an â€œundeniable contractionâ€ in the sector â€“ fewer series submitted, shorter formats, and seasons with fewer episodes â€“ an unexpected benefit has emerged:Â 
	

	â€œTodayâ€™s series creation seems to be less about scale and more about accuracy. There are fewer epic narratives and more concentrated, sometimes harsh offerings, often directly connected to a world under tension.â€Â 

	Talking about the selection, they noted: â€œEurope is asserting itself as a nerve center of creativity.â€Â 

	Apart from Belgiumâ€™s strong showing with â€œBreendonk,â€ â€œThe Best Immigrantâ€ andÂ  â€œEternal,â€Â Sweden will be represented by â€œMy Brotherâ€ and â€œBurden of Justice.â€ Poland will have two series in the official selection for the very first time: â€œLove Is Enoughâ€ and â€œVariola Vera.â€

	The creators have been responding to the rise of authoritarian and fascist systems, stated Herszberg and Lavigne.

	â€œWhether rooted in history or veering toward barely veiled anticipation, these series question our ability to resist, collaborate, or flee.â€Â 

	This includes â€œBreendonkâ€ and Spainâ€™s â€œThe Anatomy of a Moment,â€ as well as â€œThe Best Immigrantâ€ which depicts a government organizing the deportation of foreigners.Â Â 

	â€œThese are all works of fiction that implicitly extend the prophetic intuitions of â€˜Years and Yearsâ€™ by [Welsh screenwriter and producer] Russell T Davies, our guest of honor, and force viewers to take a stand: submit, collaborate, resist from within, or go underground?â€

	Themes of violence and masculinity in crisis will be explored in â€œThe Audacityâ€ and â€œDear Killer Nannies,â€ which follows Pablo Escobarâ€™s son and explores â€œbrutality as a legacy.â€ John Leguizamo will play Escobar.Â 

	In the International Panorama, the lawyers in Swedenâ€™s â€œBurden of Justiceâ€ will have to test their own convictions â€“ in â€œWaiting for the Out,â€ a philosophy teacher ends up working in prison. The show is based on Andy Westâ€™s memoir â€œThe Life Inside: A Memoir of Prison, Family and Learning to be Free.â€ The cast is led by Josh Finan, known for â€œThe Responder.â€

	That being said, Herszberg and Lavigne stressed that â€œheroines are never far away and their struggles are a powerful theme throughout the selection.â€Â 

	Australian â€œDustfallâ€ takes on the sexual violence suffered by women, while â€œBabiesâ€ explores â€œthe joys, sorrows, and social pressures experienced by infertile women.â€ French series â€œAll Shapes of Us,â€ created by Fanny Riedberger, wonâ€™t shy away from the topic of eating disorders.
	

	In addition to â€œAll Shapes of Usâ€ featuring Catherine Frot, French Competition will welcome â€œCamarades,â€ â€œEldoradoâ€ with JÃ©rÃ©mie RÃ©nier and Karim Leklou, â€œSummer Of â€™36,â€ â€œUnchainedâ€ and â€œPrivilÃ¨gesâ€ with Manon Bresch and Melvil Poupaud.

	And as for genre offerings? There will be â€œburlesque Westernâ€ (â€œLucky Lukeâ€), Japanese science fiction (â€œQueen of Marsâ€) and Korean and German comedies (â€œThe Legend of Kitchen Soldier,â€ â€œThe Flawsâ€).Â 

	â€œMore necessary than ever, this yearâ€™s series remind us that telling stories about the world remains an essential way of questioning it. And sometimes, an invitation not to resign ourselves to it.â€

	John Hopewell contributed to this article.

	The film stars Bhuman Bhargav Das, Sukanya Boruah and Mrinmoy Das.


	â€œWe were deeply impressed by this beautiful, contemporary Huckleberry Finnâ€“like story set in todayâ€™s global, hectic world, one that contemplates the world that younger generations will inherit,â€ said MMM. â€œâ€˜Not a Heroâ€™ is a film about roots and origins, friendship and values â€“ an encounter between younger and older generations, and a reconciliation between the world of yesterday and the one the protagonists will have to face tomorrow.â€

	Das is known for intimate narratives exploring human connection, self-discovery and maturation against natural landscapes. Her previous works include â€œVillage Rockstarsâ€ (2017), which represented India at the 2019 Academy Awards; â€œBulbul Can Singâ€ (2018); â€œToraâ€™s Husbandâ€ (2022); and â€œVillage Rockstars 2â€ (2024). 	â€œNot a Heroâ€ is produced by Flying River Films in India, Akanga Film Asia in Singapore and TrainTripper Films in India.
	

	Chippy Babu and Abhishek Sharma of TrainTripper Films stated: â€œTrainTripper Films has always supported filmmakers who have a distinct voice that have empowered change, no matter how small it may seem, even as a conversation starter. title: â€˜The Haunting of Hill Houseâ€™ Stage Adaptation to Launch U.K. Tour (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Shirley Jacksonâ€™s classic horror novel â€œThe Haunting of Hill Houseâ€ is being adapted for the stage, with a U.K. tour launching this fall. The produc
body:
Shirley Jacksonâ€™s classic horror novel â€œThe Haunting of Hill Houseâ€ is being adapted for the stage, with a U.K. tour launching this fall. The production marks the latest iteration of Jacksonâ€™s 1959 supernatural thriller, following the 2018 Netflix series that brought the story to a new generation of viewers.

	The production centers on a group of investigators who take on the mystery of Hill House, with curiosity descending into fear as strange disturbances ripple through the mansionâ€™s corridors.
	

	Olivier and BAFTA award-winner Stef Smith has written the stage adaptation, which will be directed by Martin Constantine. Wiltshire Creative is producing in association with Theatr Clwyd, with Mark Puddle, Alexander â€œSandyâ€ Marshall and Patrick Myles presenting.


	â€œFrom film and television to the stage, my mother Shirley Jacksonâ€™s legacy continues to endure through her iconic novel â€˜The Haunting of Hill House,'â€ said Laurence J. Hyman, Jacksonâ€™s son. â€œIâ€™m thrilled that this haunting classic will return in a new form, and that Stef Smithâ€™s adaptation will capture the novelâ€™s remarkable and unsettling spirit for audiences in a whole new way.â€

	Smith described adapting Jacksonâ€™s work as â€œa true privilege,â€ calling it â€œone of the greatest supernatural novels of the last one hundred years.â€

	â€œI find Shirley Jacksonâ€™s world intoxicating, thrilling and gut-wrenching,â€ Smith said. â€œI believe there is something so deeply theatrical at the heart of Hill House. From the spooky, to the surreal, through heartache and hope. I hope that our cast of characters will take the audience along for a ride quite unlike anything else. Above all we will examine that the biggest horrors are usually human.â€
	

	The production launches Sept. 11 at Salisbury Playhouse, running through Oct. 3 before transferring to Richmond Theatre Oct. 6-10. The tour continues to Theatr Clwyd (Oct. 13-17), Theatre Royal Brighton (Oct. 20-24), Palace Theatre Manchester (Oct. 27-31), Liverpool Everyman & Playhouse (Nov. 3-7), and concludes at Royal Lyceum Theatre in Edinburgh Nov. 10-14.

	Jackson (1916-1965) was an American writer celebrated for horror and mystery works. Over her career spanning more than two decades, she authored six novels, two memoirs and more than 200 short stories. Her novels include â€œThe Road Through the Wall,â€ â€œHangsaman,â€ â€œThe Birdâ€™s Nest,â€ â€œThe Sundialâ€ and â€œWe Have Always Lived in the Castle.â€

	Smithâ€™s theater credits include â€œRoadkillâ€ (Theatre Royal Stratford East, winner of the Olivier Award for Outstanding Achievement in an Affiliate Theatre), â€œGirl in the Machine,â€ â€œSwallowâ€ (Traverse Theatre/Edinburgh Festival Fringe) and â€œHuman Animalsâ€ (Royal Court Theatre). Her screenwriting credits include â€œFloat,â€ which won the BAFTA Scotland Award for best television scripted, and â€œThe Outrun.â€

	Constantine is an award-winning theater and opera director whose theatre credits include â€œPeter Panâ€ (Storyhouse Theatre, Chester), â€œThe Owl and the Pussycatâ€ and â€œMarshaâ€ (Arcola Theatre). His opera credits include â€œThe Elixir of Love,â€ â€œThe Silent Twinsâ€ (Almeida Theatre) and â€œDead Man Walking.â€

	Puddle has over 20 years of experience producing and touring large-scale plays and musicals across the West End, U.K. and internationally. West End highlights include co-producing â€œDr. Strangeloveâ€ (starring Steve Coogan), â€œElektraâ€ (starring Brie Larson), â€œTrue Westâ€ (starring Kit Harington and Johnny Flynn) and â€œThe Secret Diary of Adrian Mole: The Musical.â€

	The production is supported using public funding by Arts Council England.

title: Wim Wenders Says â€˜We Have to Stay Out of Politicsâ€™ as Berlinale Jury Fields Questions About Israel and Palestine: Filmmakers â€˜Have to Do the Work of People, Not the Work of Politiciansâ€™
description: The Berlin Film Festival got off to a political start on Thursday as the competition jury, led by Wim Wenders, fielded several questions about the c
body:
The Berlin Film Festival got off to a political start on Thursday as the competition jury, led by Wim Wenders, fielded several questions about the current state of the world, including the war in Gaza.

	Asked if films can affect change in the political realm, the celebrated German director said that â€œmovies can change the world,â€ but â€œnot in a political way.â€

	â€œNo movie has really changed any politicianâ€™s idea. But we can change the idea people have of how they should live,â€ he continued. â€œThereâ€™s a big discrepancy on this planet between people who want to live their lives and governments who have other ideas. So I think films enter that discrepancy.â€
	

	Wenders is serving as president of this yearâ€™s jury, which includes American helmer Reinaldo Marcus Green (â€œKing Richardâ€), Japanese filmmaker Hikari (â€œRental Familyâ€), â€œThe Zone of Interestâ€ producer Ewa PuszczyÅ„ska, Nepalese director Min Bahadur Bham (â€œShambalaâ€), South Korean actress Bae Doona and Indian director-producer Shivendra Singh Dungarpur (â€œCelluloid Manâ€).


	The jury was then questioned specifically about the ongoing conflict in Gaza and the support the German government â€” which funds much of the festival â€” has shown for Israel.

	PuszczyÅ„ska was the first to respond, saying that she felt the question was â€œa bit unfair.â€

	â€œOf course, we are trying to talk to people â€” every single viewer â€” to make them think, but we cannot be responsible for what their decision would be to support Israel or the decision to support Palestine,â€ she said. â€œThere are many other wars where genocide is committed, and we do not talk about that. So this is a very complicated question and I think itâ€™s a bit unfair asking us what do you think, how we support, not support, talking to our governments or not.â€ 
	

	Wenders added that as filmmakers, â€œWe have to stay out of politics because if we make movies that are dedicatedly political, we enter the field of politics. But we are the counterweight of politics, we are the opposite of politics. We have to do the work of people, not the work of politicians.â€

	The livestream of the press conference experienced technical difficulties during this question, with some inquiring if the feed was cut purposefully. But the Berlinale said in a later statement: â€œWe had technical problems with the web streaming of the Press Conference with the International Jury this morning.Â We would like to extend our sincere apologies.Â The full recording of the Press Conference will be made available on theÂ Berlinale WebsiteÂ and onÂ YouTubeÂ as soon as possible.â€

	Elsewhere during the press conference, Wenders â€” who is no stranger to the Berlinale, having received an honorary Golden Bear in 2015 â€” talked about what makes the festival stand out from others. â€œYou can be sure youâ€™ll see more facets of the world than in any other festival,â€ he said. â€œThatâ€™s their great strength, you know?â€

	The 76th edition of the Berlin Film Festival kicks off on Thursday night with the premiere of Shahrbanoo Sadatâ€™s â€œNo Good Menâ€ and runs until Feb. 22.

Katie Holmes penned a heartfelt tribute to her â€œDawsonâ€™s Creekâ€ co-star James Van Der Beek following the news of his death at the age of 48. 

	Holmes â€” who broke out on the teen drama as Joey Potter, the love interest of Van Der Beekâ€™s Dawson Leery â€” posted on Instagram late Wednesday night to share a handwritten note to him. He died on Wednesday after being diagnosed with colorectal cancer in 2023 and is survived by his wife, Kimberly Brook, and their six children.
	

	â€œI formed some words with a heavy heart,â€ Holmes wrote in the caption of her post. â€œThis is a lot to process. I am so grateful to have shared in a piece of Jamesâ€™ journey. He is beloved. Kimberly, we love you and will be here always for you and your beautiful children.â€


	Holmes and Van Der Beek starred together on â€œDawsonâ€™s Creekâ€ from 1998 to 2003. In the handwritten letter, Holmes thanked Van Der Beek for all the memories they made together. â€œTo share space with your imagination is sacred â€” breathing the same air in the land of make believe and trusting that each othersâ€™ hearts are safe in their expression,â€ she wrote.

	â€œThese are some of the memories, along with laughter, conversations about life, James Taylor songs â€” adventures of a unique youthâ€¦ Bravery. Compassion. Selflessness. Strength. An appreciation for life and the action taken to live life with the integrity that life is art â€” creating a beautiful marriage, six loving children â€“ the journey of a hero. I mourn this loss with a heart holding the reality of his absence and a deep gratitude for his imprint on it. To Kimberly and the children, we are here for you always. And will always be there to shower you with love and compassion.â€

title: EFM Animation Days: From Black Death Romantic Horror to a Buzzy Time-Travel Tale, 10 Titles to Track

body:
Â If Cannesâ€™ Annecy Animation Showcase is now an established appetizer for Juneâ€™s Annecy Festival, this first EFM Animation Days lineup is nothing short of a hearty breakfast. Beyond the five projects listed in Annecyâ€™s Friday presentation, a carefully curated selection completes a solid slate of 28 presentations. Producers will have the opportunity to present projects at different stages of development and financing, but all have something of note and are worth discovering.Â 
	

	Ranging from small independent producers to well established animation powerhouses, all teams will use Berlinale as a global platform to prove once again the mediumâ€™s potential, and its strong market appeal.Â 


	Our 10 picks underscore the diversity of what the animation industry is capable of in these shifting landscapes: Pushing forward unique creative visions and bold artistic choices.Â 

	Annecy EFM Animation ShowcaseÂ 

	This yearâ€™s five titles range from historical drama to folk horror and sci-fi eco-conscious adventure, carefully selected by Annecyâ€™s teams.Â 



	

					A Door to the Woods
	



	â€œA Door to the Woods,â€ Jola Kudela (Poland, France, Czech Republic, Belgium)

	Inspired by real people and true historical events, this new animated feature tells the tale of two young Poles (Antek, hiding in Breslau and Wiktor surviving a gulag) reunited decades after their separation through Jola, Antekâ€™s granddaughter, whose creative future Wiktor helps unlock. A voyage through the history of three oppressive regimes that tore Europe apart during the last century: Fascism, Stalinism, and Communism.
	

	Producers: Opus Film, Les Films Du Poisson Rouge, PFX

	Genre: Historical Drama

	Artistic technique: 2D, 3D, rotoscope

	Completion: 2028



	

					Granny is a Tree!
	



	â€œGranny is a Tree!â€ Hugo de Faucompret (France, Luxembourg)

	Granny Onion, Janeâ€™s whimsical grand-mother, takes one last eternal after-lunch nap. Against her motherâ€™s decision, Jane takes it upon herself to fulfil her grannyâ€™sÂ last wish: Granny Onionâ€™s will states that she choses natural organic reduction for her funeral. In short, she wants to be â€œhumusedâ€! CÃ©cile, Janeâ€™s mom, is against it. Besides, itâ€™s not even legal in France!Â  But Jane is determined. And with her grannyâ€™s facetious ghost, sheâ€™ll set off on a wild escape to the edge of the tangible world.

	Producers: LaÃ¯dak Films, Dandelooo, Doghouse

	Genre: Comedy, Adventure, Modern tale

	Artistic technique: 2D, hand-painted backgrounds

	Completion: 2028



	

					MouMoush â€“ The King of Plastic
	



	â€œMouMoush â€“ The King of Plasticâ€ Milorad Krstic (Hungary)

	While vacationing in Transylvania, two curious siblings (10 year-old Margot and 14-year-old Liam) from Paris are thrust into a time-traveling adventure. Their mission? To thwart MouMoush, a powerful figure known as the King of Plastic who is plotting to seize control of the entire world. From the team behind â€œRuben Brandtâ€comes this awaited feature blending fantasy, time travel and environmental themes together, along with the directorsâ€™ unique humor.

	Producer: Mumus Production LLC

	Genre: Fantasy, Adventure

	Artistic technique: 2D, 3D

	Completion: 2028



	

									Pesta
	



	â€œPestaâ€ Hanne Berkaak (Norway, Germany, France)

	As the horrors of the Black Death fuel fear and superstition, Catholic noble girl Astrid experiences the bliss of first love with Ilkka, a heathen outcast. When Ilkka is accused of witchcraft by a system based on lies, telling the truth becomes the most dangerous act of all. Set in Norway in 1349, â€œPestaâ€ is a romantic horror folk tale that will blur the lines between reality and fantasy to craft a compelling story of love beyond societal norms. A title that promises chilling journey into the dark side of Nordic folklore.

	Producers: Mikrofilm, Knudsen Pictures, Rosalie Films and Charades
	

	Genre: Romantic Horror

	Artistic technique: 2D

	Completion: 2029

	â€œZakoâ€ Tigran Arakelyan (Armenia, France, Lithuania)

	Otherwise known as Sargis Mangasaryan, the Armenian painter Zako (a name he was given by the Germans) survived Naziâ€™s POW camps only by drawing portraits of his tormentors. In 1956, he discovered with shock one of Picassoâ€™s iconic masterpieces: â€œGuernicaâ€ and realized how much of his own talent was stifled by both Nazi Germany and later the communism of Armeniaâ€™s Soviet Era. According to Arakelyan, who adapts the graphic novel â€œZakoâ€with this feature, the filmwill use modern VR technology combined with classical CG tools to create a new visual language, the makers say, fit to adapt this story to the screen.

	Producers: OnOff Studio, Sacrebleu Productions, Broom Films

	Genre: Historical Drama

	Artistic technique: 3D

	Completion: 2028

	Spotlights

	Beyond this lineup, Spotlights from Canada, Germany, U.K. and CEE and an International Animation Showcase complete this packed slate. Here are five projects at (very) early stages that piqued our curiosity.Â 

	â€œFifteen Dogsâ€ Chris Landreth (Canada)

	Based on AndrÃ© Alexisâ€™s Giller Prize-winning novel, â€œFifteen Dogsâ€ marks the latest project from Copperheart Ent. (â€œNight of the Zoopocalypseâ€). What begins with a wager between Greek gods who grant a group of Toronto dogs human intelligence turns into quick-paced animated drama, where these newly smart pets navigate shifting loyalties, new language, and emerging identities.Â 

	Producers: Copperheart Entertainment (Steven Hoban, Mark Smith)

	Genre: Drama (teens and adults)

	â€œAcornâ€™s Adventureâ€ Filip MaÅ¡ek (Czech Republic, Germany)

	Pitched last year as part of Annecyâ€™s MIFA Features presentation, â€œAcornâ€™s Adventureâ€ puts animation in the hands of children, with visionary director Filip MaÅ¡ek at the wheel. The film is a beautiful CG project filled with quirky forest characters designed by the daring imaginations of nature-loving children. Quido, a boy made of acorns, will try to find its purpose in a forest village where every tiny character seems to already have a definite role. An animated adventure with a catchy and child-friendly log(line): be yourself, even if you donâ€™t know what that is yet.
	

	Producers: Pure Shore, Fabian & Fred

	Genre: Family-friendly AdventureÂ 

	â€œThe Pirate Kingâ€ (Netherlands/Taiwan)

	Presented by Alex Dowding, Submarineâ€™s animation producer on the project, â€œThe Pirate King,â€ a 3D animated fantasy adventure, is currently in development as a rather unique Netherlands-Taiwanese co-production. A story of unlikely friendship, myth, and adventure, blended in a project that reflects Submarineâ€™s passion for globally collaborative storytelling.

	Producers: Submarine, Studio2 Animation Lab

	Genre: Fantasy, Adventure



	

					Treasure Island
	



	â€œTreasure Islandâ€ (Germany)

	What if the hero of Stevensonâ€™s beloved classic was a girlâ€¦ and a cat? In this new animated musical, Jane Hawkins is fed up with the boring life of her cat boarding school. Could that ship setting off on a treacherous treasure hunt to a remote island be the key to her freedom?Â 

	Animated in lush CG animation, this new take on the pirate classic story with an animal twist could conquer the hearts of global audiences.Â 

	Producers: Little Dream Entertainment

	Genre: Family Entertainment, Musical

	â€œReds & Graysâ€ (U.K.)

	Powered by Two Daughters Entertainment (â€œMaster Moleyâ€, â€œThe Land of Sometimesâ€), â€œReds & Graysâ€ is an original story rooted deep in the real-life ecological conflict between red and grey squirrels. In a distinct British setting, this adventure blends romance, rebellion and political intrigue in what seems like a funny and fluffy Romeo and Juliet inspired story, with universal themes.

	Producers: Two Daughters Entertainment

	Genre: Family Entertainment

body:
Reese Witherspoon
                          Heartbroken Over James Van Der Beek's Death
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 12, 2026
                            4:39 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Reese Witherspoon is honoring James Van Der Beek's life as she mourns his death, saying she's heartbroken over the loss of the talented actor.
      
    
          Witherspoon paid tribute to Van Der Beek on her Instagram Story after he passed away Wednesday in Austin, Texas. While an official cause of death has not been released, Van Der Beek had been battling stage 3 colorectal cancer since August 2023.
      
    
          Reese writes she's "devastated" about Van Der Beek's passing, calling him an "extraordinary, talented man who also showed great kindness and grace in every action.â€ Witherspoon went on to say she's praying for Van Der Beek's family.
      
    
          Van Der Beek's final acting role will come in the upcoming TV series, "Elle," based on Reese's iconic character, Elle Woods, from the 2001 flick "Legally Blonde." Witherspoon is an executive producer on the show, which is set to premiere on July 1. In the series, Van Der Beek portrays Dean Wilson -- a school superintendent and mayoral candidate.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          As you know ... Van Der Beek enjoyed a successful Hollywood career, breaking out as Dawson Leery on the hit 1990s series â€œDawsonâ€™s Creek.â€ He later landed recurring roles on several other big shows, including â€œHow I Met Your Mother,â€ â€œOne Tree Hill,â€ and â€œPose.â€
      
    
          In addition to his television work, James starred in several films, including "Varsity Blues," "Scary Movie," "The Rules of Attraction" and more.
      
    
          He's survived by his wife Kimberley and their six children. James was 48.
      
    
          RIP

description:
James Van Der Beek
                          GoFundMe Soars Above $1 Million After Death
body:
James Van Der Beek
                          GoFundMe Soars Above $1 Million After Death
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 12, 2026
                            4:09 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          James Van Der Beek's GoFundMe has raised more than a million bucks less than 24 hours after his death was announced ... and it's still growing.
      
    
          As of Thursday morning, the crowdfunding page has $1.2 million in donations, from fans and big-name friends alike. "Dancing with the Stars" pro Derek Hough dropped $1,000, Oscar-winner Zoe Saldana -- using her married name of Zoe SaldaÃ±a-Perego -- donated $2,500, the Marla Maples Foundation sent in $5,000, and Lyn Lear, the late Norman Learâ€™s wife, and YouTuber Codie Sanchez even each donated $5,000 on a monthly basis!
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Notably, TMZ has not verified the donations -- but it's clear Van Der Beek's death hit people in the heartstrings, as more than 24,000 donations have poured in.
      

          TMZ broke the news -- James died Wednesday morning ... and his family confirmed the sad update with a touching post noting he passed "peacefully."
      
    
          Tributes from heartbroken friends and colleagues poured in ... and former pro wrestler Stacy Keibler even said farewell by sharing a photo of him watching the sunset from his wheelchair and reflecting on his "final days."
      
    
          Van Der Beek -- most known for his starring roles in "Dawson's Creek" and the film "Varsity Blues" -- was diagnosed with stage 3 colorectal cancer in mid-2023 and he revealed the diagnosis in November 2024.
      
    
          His ongoing cancer treatment was not only emotionally stressful for him and his wife Kimberly, but financially as well -- he even auctioned off some iconic memorbilia to fund his cancer treatment. Kimberly wrote on the family's GoFundMe page that his "medical care and the extended fight against cancer have left the family out of funds."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          He left behind 6 young kids he shared with Kimberly.
      
    
          RIP
